timeline.message:
[JBTM-3318] Adjusting LRA annotation 'timeLimit' value with factor

This is a reflection over the LRA annotations to fix timing issues on
AMS CI which is slow and it may happen that the LRA is
timeouted/cancelled before the business method is invoked.

That's a trouble as the TCK tests are written in way to get the business
method invoke and only after that the timeout should be elapsed
sometimes later.

[JBTM-3318] Adjusting LRA annotation 'timeLimit' value with factor

This is a reflection over the LRA annotations to fix timing issues on
AMS CI which is slow and it may happen that the LRA is
timeouted/cancelled before the business method is invoked.

That's a trouble as the TCK tests are written in way to get the business
method invoke and only after that the timeout should be elapsed
sometimes later.

timeline.bodyText: My IDE says this is a varargs param so you don't need to use null.
timeline.author: mmusgrov

timeline.bodyText:
Fiendishly clever.
As an aside, we'd need to remember to change this class if the LRA annotation changes in MP-LRA 1.x.
timeline.author: mmusgrov

replies.bodyText: sure. I think that should be fine as this is part of the test which is usually compiled and run. The compilation would fail if the LRAWrapped does not implement some LRA method (or implement a different definition).
replies.author: ochaloup

timeline.bodyText: I think you prefer logging instead of stack traces.
timeline.author: xstefank

timeline.bodyText: wouldn't be better to use getName() here?
timeline.author: xstefank

replies.bodyText:
not using the getName() was intentional. If the extension is used for deployments where these resources are not provided then using of the Class.getName() makes the whole NarayanaLRARecoveryfailing as it tries to link a class which is not on classpath.
It's the case e.g. for lra-test-basic where those classes are not available.
replies.author: ochaloup

replies.bodyText: wouldn't it be better than to add LRA TCK dependency to the basic module (or better this module) then to keep track of possible renames in the dependent project? :)
replies.author: xstefank

replies.bodyText:
I was investigating here a bit about what's needed to do and the TCK dependency would need to be added to any module which is to use the arquillian extension. I don't want to add such requirements on users.
This is an enhancement for the TCK behaviour (and I agree it's a bit hacky but without definition of long pause time into TCK our AMS CI is currently in troubles to get running properly the LRA tests) and not any other tests.
When there is a failure on loading class (ie. the TCK tests is renamed) then if the test starts to fail it will be needed to investigate the reasons.
By me this loosely coupling of this Arq extenstion to TCK tests is desired here.
replies.author: ochaloup
